title: midttrafik
content:
I know that this is customized a bit, but which font is it based upon?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725021719im_/http:/typophile.com/files/jpg_logo_midt_5706.png)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [jpg\_logo\_midt.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725021719/http:/typophile.com/files/jpg_logo_midt_0.png) | 17.69 KB |
author: saeglopur

comments.content:
Sorry, it sounds probably helpless and lazy but to me, this logotype has nothing really distinctive. You could re-do the same starting with any standard/neutral/basic sans of your choice, simply editing it a bit. The only thing you need to keep in mind is /k design. You could start from [Helvetica Neue](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725021719/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/helvetica+neue) to [Myriad](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725021719/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/myriad), [Trebuchet](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725021719/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/trebuchet) or [Arial](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725021719/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/arial)...  
My choice here, Trebuchet Bold, 15 min reworked

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725021719im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Untitled-1_4691.png)

Good answer Ryuk.  
One of my favorite blogs -- called "Cutting Edge Logos" -- reveals the secrets of logo designers:

---------------- start quote ----------------------------  
 How to design a logo?  
 1. Set the name in a retail typeface  
 2. Cut off some corners in Illustrator  
 3. Cash a big check  
---------------- end quote -----------------------------

For a collection of examples see [http://cuttingedgelogos.tumblr.com/archive](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725021719/http:/cuttingedgelogos.tumblr.com/archive "http://cuttingedgelogos.tumblr.com/archive")  
Don
Thanks for the answers, guys! Really useful - and amazing blog btw :)
